Yamamoto wins wheelchair

Japan’s Hiroyuki Yamamoto won the men’s wheelchair race in the 2013 Boston Marathon Monday, finishing in 1 hour 25 minutes 32 seconds.

Pictures: Boston Marathon scenes

Rita Jeptoo of Kenya won the women's Boston Marathon in an unofficial time of 2:26:25.
Shalane Flanagan of Marblehead, third from right, ran alongside other elite runners in Wellesley. AP Photo/ Michael Dwyer
Elite men's marathoners including Levy Matebo, fourth from left, ran through Wellesley. AP Photo/ Michael Dwyer
Tatyana McFadden crossed the finish line to capture the women's wheelchair race. David L. Ryan/ Globe Staff
Men's wheelchair winner, Hiroyuki Yamamoto of Japan, crossed the finish line. David L. Ryan/ Globe Staff
Yolanda Caballero led the women at the twelve-mile mark in Wellesley. AP Photo/ Michael Dwyer
A sea of runners began the Boston Marathon. AP Photo/Stew Milne
The rest of the pack took off shortly after the elite men's race got underway. Dina Rudick/ Globe Staff
The elite men's race started in Hopkinton at 10 a.m. Dina Rudick/ Globe Staff
The elite women began their race. Pat Greenhouse/ Globe Staff
